text: VOICEOVER: Previously on the OC
MIKE: It's one thousand three hundred and seventy-eight miles to Austin
and I'm going to drive there. Send me your suggestions, tweet me with all the places and
the things that I should eat between here and Austin.
LADY: I think you should go to Vegas. MAN: Vegas. MIKE: Vegas. LADY: Vegas.
*rock music* *car revving*
*brake noise*
*brake noise*
MIKE: Right, this is red, but I can go right. Can I go right? Auugh
I am gonna die.
Okay. Come on, WOOHOO, VEGAS!
*music playing*
MIKE: I think we can all admit that we're slightly surprised that I made it, but it is 12:30 AM,
and I am so hungry, but luckily for me, you guys recommended that I eat at the Earl of Sandwich,
which is open twenty-four hours, so I'm off there now, and then I think I might come home, uh, go to bed,
because I'm quite tired, and because it's been quite a long PPPBBLL whatever.
*music playing*
That Earl of Sandwich place was decent, thank you! I got a ham and mustard, which was a pretty simple choice,
but done really well. And also, look!
You know it's been a good night when the sun's coming up and you're about to go to bed.
*rock music playing*
MIKE: So, I've just been to Hash a Go Go, as recommended by you, and I had a chicken pot pie.
Now, this chicken pot pie was the biggest thing that I have ever seen.
D'you see that guy looking at the fridge?
Hahaha!
It was delicious. It had a really lovely, creamy sauce, loads of really delicious, well cooked vegetables,
which actually made a massive difference.
It was so good. The pastry was...was... I dunno It had, like, potatoes at the bottom or something.
I finished about and eighth of it, and then whimped out.
*rock music playing*
POLICEMAN: Arms up in the back seat so I can see you raise your hands.
I need you to walk over that way. Keep your hands up.
*rock music playing*
MIKE: That is amazing.
It's amazing!
That was THE best red curry that I've ever had
You saw it got the smoothness and the creaminess of the coconut, which was really nice,
but then the spice sort of kicked in, and just as you felt it was getting a little bit too spicy,
suddenly you got the freshness of the Thai basil. I was not expecting to eat my best Thai red curry in Vegas.
Right, so we're back in the car, mainly because I want to get my money's worth, and my Vegas adventure is over
The food here has been amazing, and that's all down to you and your suggestions,
because otherwise I would've just gone to the same old boring places.
Now, I need to go to my next destination. I do not know where that is, so I have prepared a tweet
saying that I will take the most popular suggestion from you and go there. Air B&B pending.
This is me pressing "Send."
Send.
The votes are in, the sun has gone down, and I am driving to...
The Grand Canyon
This is surely nothing but a recipe for success. Let's see what happens.
